name: Gyudon
ingredients: 500g thinly sliced beef (chuck, ribeye, or skirt steak)
1 cup dashi (Japanese fish stock) or chicken broth
instructions: Prepare the Dashi (if using): If using dashi powder, dissolve it in the water according to package directions.
Cook the Beef and Onions: In a large skillet or pot, cook the onions over medium heat until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the onions and set aside.
Brown the Beef: Add the beef to the skillet and cook until browned, stirring occasionally.

Simmer the Sauce: Return the onions to the skillet. Add the soy sauce, mirin, sugar, dashi, and ginger. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Serve: Divide the cooked rice among bowls. Top with the beef and onion mixture and any desired garnishes.
